channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Significant vegetation had to be cut back to replace a damaged fence (caused by the vegetation). Please can you arrange for someone to pick the green waste up as there is no way to dispose of it, 26th August
item.description:
Green waste is on the bank of the brook behind calspick way
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calspick Way, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights, 26th August
item.description:
Evesham Road CLOSED Why repair a pavement on Southam Road installing Temporary Lights when there is excessive traffic on this road!!! Clueless !!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracks in cyclepath near here - read on, 26th August
item.description:
The cycle path from the start and for some 100 metres is cracked open. Someone has partially filled it with granite sand (IMO) whereas it should be filled (now) with bitumen or runny tarmac otherwise further damage can be expected in the winter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tommy Taylors Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a long longitudinal crack in the road, 26th August
item.description:
There is a long longitudinal crack in the road - may I suggest it needs filling with bitumen or runny tarmac
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Roman Hackle Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household waste dumped, 26th August
item.description:
House hold waste as been again dumped on the corner of queens close. There are two black bags of rubbish, a recycling bin, a duvet and some metal. It was dumped Friday evening/early Saturday morning. This is a frequent problem, can we have a camera to catch who is doing this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Close, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 26th August
item.description:
Give and take plus temporary footway closure please cut back overgrown hedge an vegetation and brambles back to boundary approximately15 metres x 3 metres (Overgrown Hedge)

item.title: Pavement surface has broken away, 26th August
item.description:
Along the dropped kerb pavement outside No 16 Malleson Road. It has been getting progressively worse as time goes on. It is becoming a tripping hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Tree removal - agreed October 2024, 26th August
item.description:
It was agreed in October 2024 that the tree outside 47 Byron Road would be removed due to the size of it, as well as the branches thay cause damage to our cars. It is not well maintained and not of a height that we are able to maintain it ourselves. We would like an update on when this job will be completed please. We've attached the email agreeing this previously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Byron Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why when the Evesham Road is closed you have decided to do works on the Prestbury Winchcombe Road close to Prestbury. This has made Southam village almost a no go area which will be made considerably worse when the schools go back next week. Why is their no coordination regarding roadworks so traffic can at least flow when the Prestbury Road is now the only route due the Evesham Road closure.your comments would be appreciated, 26th August
item.description:
Near mill Lane Prestbury, traffic lights
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
